Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is slightly grooved and lightly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394615) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394615)
